alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 14 at 11:14AM PDT until March 14 at 12:15PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Santa Cruz County in northern California... * Until 1215 PM PDT. * At 1114 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that the San Lorenzo River at Big Trees is approaching Minor Flood Stage. Latest gauge observation reported 16.01 feet. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Cruz and Felton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
